content:
Quaternion Struct

Definition

Represents a vector that is used to encode three-dimensional physical rotations.

In this Article

public struct Quaternion : IEquatable<System.Numerics.Quaternion>
Inheritance
Object
ValueType
Quaternion

Remarks

The Quaternion structure is used to efficiently rotate an object about the (x,y,z) vector by the angle theta, where: 

w = cos(theta/2)

Constructors

Quaternion(Vector3, Single)

Creates a quaternion from the specified vector and rotation parts.

public Quaternion (System.Numerics.Vector3 vectorPart, float scalarPart);
Parameters
vectorPart
Vector3

The vector part of the quaternion.

scalarPart
Single

The rotation part of the quaternion.

Quaternion(Single, Single, Single, Single)

Constructs a quaternion from the specified components.

public Quaternion (float x, float y, float z, float w);
Parameters
x
Single

The value to assign to the X component of the quaternion.

y
Single

The value to assign to the Y component of the quaternion.

z
Single

The value to assign to the Z component of the quaternion.

w
Single

The value to assign to the W component of the quaternion.

Fields

W

The rotation component of the quaternion.

public float W;

X

The X value of the vector component of the quaternion.

public float X;

Y

The Y value of the vector component of the quaternion.

public float Y;

Z

The Z value of the vector component of the quaternion.

public float Z;

Properties

Identity

Gets a quaternion that represents no rotation.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Identity { get; }
Value
Quaternion

A quaternion whose values are (0, 0, 0, 1).

IsIdentity

Gets a value that indicates whether the current instance is the identity quaternion.

public bool IsIdentity { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the current instance is the identity quaternion; otherwise, false.

Methods

Add(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Adds each element in one quaternion with its corresponding element in a second quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Add (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion that contains the summed values of value1 and value2.

Concatenate(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Concatenates two quaternions.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Concatenate (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion rotation in the series.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion rotation in the series.

Returns
Quaternion

A new quaternion representing the concatenation of the value1 rotation followed by the value2 rotation.

Conjugate(Quaternion)

Returns the conjugate of a specified quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Conjugate (System.Numerics.Quaternion value);
Parameters
value
Quaternion

The quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

A new quaternion that is the conjugate of value.

CreateFromAxisAngle(Vector3, Single)

Creates a quaternion from a vector and an angle to rotate about the vector.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion CreateFromAxisAngle (System.Numerics.Vector3 axis, float angle);
Parameters
axis
Vector3

The vector to rotate around.

angle
Single

The angle, in radians, to rotate around the vector.

Returns
Quaternion

The newly created quaternion.

CreateFromRotationMatrix(Matrix4x4)

Creates a quaternion from the specified rotation matrix.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion CreateFromRotationMatrix (System.Numerics.Matrix4x4 matrix);
Parameters
matrix
Matrix4x4

The rotation matrix.

Returns
Quaternion

The newly created quaternion.

CreateFromYawPitchRoll(Single, Single, Single)

Creates a new quaternion from the given yaw, pitch, and roll.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion CreateFromYawPitchRoll (float yaw, float pitch, float roll);
Parameters
yaw
Single

The yaw angle, in radians, around the Y axis.

pitch
Single

The pitch angle, in radians, around the X axis.

roll
Single

The roll angle, in radians, around the Z axis.

Returns
Quaternion

The resulting quaternion.

Divide(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Divides one quaternion by a second quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Divide (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The dividend.

value2
Quaternion

The divisor.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion that results from dividing value1 by value2.

Dot(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Calculates the dot product of two quaternions.

public static float Dot (System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion1, System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion2);
Parameters
quaternion1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

quaternion2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Single

The dot product.

Equals(Quaternion)

Returns a value that indicates whether this instance and another quaternion are equal.

public bool Equals (System.Numerics.Quaternion other);
Parameters
other
Quaternion

The other quaternion.

Returns
Boolean

true if the two quaternions are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two quaternions are equal if each of their corresponding components is equal.

Equals(Object)

Returns a value that indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
Parameters
obj
Object

The object to compare with the current instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if the current instance and obj are equal; otherwise, false```. If <code>obj</code> isnull, the method returnsfalse`.

Remarks

The current instance and obj are equal if obj is a Quaternion object and the corresponding components of each matrix are equal.

GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this instance.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

The hash code.

Inverse(Quaternion)

Returns the inverse of a quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Inverse (System.Numerics.Quaternion value);
Parameters
value
Quaternion

The quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The inverted quaternion.

Length()

Calculates the length of the quaternion.

public float Length ();
Returns
Single

The computed length of the quaternion.

LengthSquared()

Calculates the squared length of the quaternion.

public float LengthSquared ();
Returns
Single

The length squared of the quaternion.

Lerp(Quaternion, Quaternion, Single)

Performs a linear interpolation between two quaternions based on a value that specifies the weighting of the second quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Lerp (System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion1, System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion2, float amount);
Parameters
quaternion1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

quaternion2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

amount
Single

The relative weight of quaternion2 in the interpolation.

Returns
Quaternion

The interpolated quaternion.

Multiply(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Returns the quaternion that results from multiplying two quaternions together.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Multiply (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The product quaternion.

Multiply(Quaternion, Single)

Returns the quaternion that results from scaling all the components of a specified quaternion by a scalar factor.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Multiply (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, float value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The source quaternion.

value2
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Quaternion

The scaled quaternion.

Negate(Quaternion)

Reverses the sign of each component of the quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Negate (System.Numerics.Quaternion value);
Parameters
value
Quaternion

The quaternion to negate.

Returns
Quaternion

The negated quaternion.

Normalize(Quaternion)

Divides each component of a specified Quaternion by its length.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Normalize (System.Numerics.Quaternion value);
Parameters
value
Quaternion

The quaternion to normalize.

Returns
Quaternion

The normalized quaternion.

Slerp(Quaternion, Quaternion, Single)

Interpolates between two quaternions, using spherical linear interpolation.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Slerp (System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion1, System.Numerics.Quaternion quaternion2, float amount);
Parameters
quaternion1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

quaternion2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

amount
Single

The relative weight of the second quaternion in the interpolation.

Returns
Quaternion

The interpolated quaternion.

Subtract(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Subtracts each element in a second quaternion from its corresponding element in a first quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion Subtract (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion containing the values that result from subtracting each element in value2 from its corresponding element in value1.

ToString()

Returns a string that represents this quaternion.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

The string representation of this quaternion.

Remarks

The numeric values in the returned string are formatted by using the conventions of the current culture. For example, for the en-US culture, the returned string might appear as {X:1.1 Y:2.2 Z:3.3 W:4.4}.

Operators

op_Addition(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Adds each element in one quaternion with its corresponding element in a second quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_Addition (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion that contains the summed values of value1 and value2.

Remarks

The Addition method defines the operaton of the addition operator for Quaternion objects.

op_Division(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Divides one quaternion by a second quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_Division (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The dividend.

value2
Quaternion

The divisor.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion that results from dividing value1 by value2.

Remarks

The Division method defines the division operation for Quaternion objects.

op_Equality(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Returns a value that indicates whether two quaternions are equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion to compare.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the two quaternions are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two quaternions are equal if each of their corresponding components is equal.

The Equality method defines the operation of the equality operator for Quaternion objects.

op_Inequality(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Returns a value that indicates whether two quaternions are not equal.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion to compare.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if value1 and value2 are not equal; otherwise, false.

op_Multiply(Quaternion, Single)

Returns the quaternion that results from scaling all the components of a specified quaternion by a scalar factor.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_Multiply (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, float value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The source quaternion.

value2
Single

The scalar value.

Returns
Quaternion

The scaled quaternion.

Remarks

The Multiply method defines the operation of the multiplication operator for Quaternion objects.

op_Multiply(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Returns the quaternion that results from multiplying two quaternions together.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_Multiply (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The product quaternion.

Remarks

The Multiply method defines the operation of the multiplication operator for Quaternion objects.

op_Subtraction(Quaternion, Quaternion)

Subtracts each element in a second quaternion from its corresponding element in a first quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_Subtraction (System.Numerics.Quaternion value1, System.Numerics.Quaternion value2);
Parameters
value1
Quaternion

The first quaternion.

value2
Quaternion

The second quaternion.

Returns
Quaternion

The quaternion containing the values that result from subtracting each element in value2 from its corresponding element in value1.

Remarks

The Subtraction method defines the operation of the subtraction operator for Quaternion objects.

op_UnaryNegation(Quaternion)

Reverses the sign of each component of the quaternion.

public static System.Numerics.Quaternion op_UnaryNegation (System.Numerics.Quaternion value);
Parameters
value
Quaternion

The quaternion to negate.

Returns
Quaternion

The negated quaternion.

Remarks

The UnaryNegation method defines the operation of the unary negation operator for Quaternion objects.
